intro: Callista hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's callista, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
